Topic.Title: Quit Asking these Stupid Questions about the Split

Message.Msg: The only stupid question is the question not asked.

Message.Title: Bought 750 shares at $80.50
Message.Msg: After I bought it, the price been going down (while the stock market is up) Did I bought the price too high? I'm just worried I have another dead money in my hands now.

Topic.Title: Quit Asking these Stupid Questions about the Split

Message.Msg: "The only stupid question is the question not asked." Really? Did your mother have any children?
you never go wrong buying coke thursdays are weak, fridays are strong don't worry
Depends on your time horizon. Short term the buy might have been on the high side. Long term it will come thru.

Topic.Title: Quit Asking these Stupid Questions about the Split

Message.Msg: I did a split in gym class. It kinda hurt.

Topic.Title: Quit Asking these Stupid Questions about the Split

Message.Msg: I as told this by a college professor. That had a phd in math.

Yes, no sweat, this one can work higher, but, there was profit taking as usual and of course concern over high fructose corn sugar prices, which is not really that big of deal from hedging and diversified products and distributions.

I plan on buying after the split and holding for the long term. Probably 1000 shares in my IRA. I also hold INTC, Duke Energy, AT&T, Valspar, Alteria, COP. Take a look at Val, its been a good along with all the others. Always remember, buy low and sell high if you have to.
